item.title: Juvenoia
item.description: Generations often criticize the generations before them as too rigid, and the generations after them as out-of-control. In book III of Odes, which is estimated to have been written circa 20 BC, Horace said: “Our sire’s age was worse than our grandsires. We, their sons, are more worthless than they; so in our turn we shall give the world a progeny yet more corrupt.” There is a name for this phenomena, coming forth as a blend of the word Juvenile and Paranoia: Juvenoia.
